thread.title: OJ Simpson set to walk free from prison THIS YEAR after serving less than a third of his 33-year sentence - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: OJ Simpson set to walk free from prison THIS YEAR after serving less than a third of his 33-year sentence - Mirror Online

author: Richard Wheatstone
title: OJ Simpson set to walk free from prison THIS YEAR after serving less than a third of his 33-year sentence - Mirror Online

organizations.name: la la land at writers guild awards

text:
OJ Simpson could be released later this year (Photo: REUTERS/Jae C. Hong) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
OJ Simspon is set to walk free from prison later this year after serving less than a third of his 33-year jail term - it has been reported. 
The former NFL star was jailed in 2008 after being found guilty of a string of charges including kidnapping, robbery and assault with a deadly weapon. 
October 1 is the earliest parole date the 69-year-old could face and Simpson is expected to be recommended for early release due to good behaviour, the Sunday Express reports . 
He has been serving his sentence at Lovelock Correctional Center in rural Nevada after being convicted over the violent robbery of a sports memorabilia dealer in a Las Vegas hotel room. Read More Moonlight outshines La La Land at Writers Guild Awards as 'Donald Trump' makes cameo appearance OJ Simpson during his infamous murder trial in 1995 (Photo: Reuters) 
An ex-business partner who visits him at the facility told the paper: "He’s convinced he’ll be coming out this fall and is counting down the days to his hearing like a kid waiting for Christmas." 
In 1995, Simpson was cleated of the brutal murders of ex-wife Nicole Brown and her friend Ron Goldman in the so-called “Trial of the Century”. 
NFL Hall of Fame member Simpson was recognised as one of the sport's greatest ever stars before his life became mired in controversey. 
He also enjoyed a successful Hollywood acting career after retiring from American Football in the Naked Gun comedy films. Read More Roots forced America to confront its ugly past - and now it's back to shake the world Simpson was one of NFL's greatest-ever players before his life plunged into controversy (Photo: Getty) 
US magazine Sports Illustrated claims he has amassed a new fortune while behind bars thanks to his £240,000-a-year NFL pension. 
Under America’s Employee Retirement Income Security Act, the pension cannot be touched by creditors, despite Simpson owing almost £27million in damages after a civil jury found him liable for the wrongful deaths of Brown and Goldman. 
But families of the pair say they have seen a “mere fraction” of their award from the civil case. 
A source close to the Goldmans said yesterday: “They have vowed to pursue him to the ends of the earth and will continue to do so after he walks out of prison. 
“His nightmare might be coming to an end, but theirs never will.” 
On October 3, 2008, Simpson was found guilty of kidnapping and robbing at gunpoint 
The dealer had, Simpson claimed, stolen a stash of his personal NFL mementos. Like us on Facebook
